Screenshot of the week!
We're adding a new page to the site. Just click on the button to the left under "Forum" labeled "Featured Screenshot" and you will be treated to a new screenshot every Monday, taken by your guildmates as they adventure through Norrath, and soon Luclin. Please send in your best and most interesting shots to Kamdar. If you need help in taking and sending shots there is a guide on this site on the links page titled "Kamdar's Guide to EQ Photography"
11/19/01
Introducing the High Council
If you have taken a look at the Members page recently, you may have noticed a bit of restructuring in our upper levels. We no longer have Leaders and Officers split up into different sections. They are now all listed under the High Council banner. This more accurately reflects the leadership of our guild, as we all are heavily involved in the decisions that run this guild's affairs. All members should feel free to come to any High Council member with their issues, problems or ideas. Our doors are always open.
11/3/01
Trade Fair
Come to the East Commons tunnel on Monday November 12 for our first official swap meet! Members will be working on their trades while supplying goods for members for free or at a fraction of the cost! It helps if you are able to bring your own raw materials. So if you need any jewelry, armor, arrows, or just want to learn a language or two, please stop by. The event will begin at around 6pm Eastern.
11/7/01
Members Page Expanded
The members section of this site now includes another page where you can view all of the members by class. This will help in determining what areas we need to beef up recruitment in. As you can see, we are fairly strong in the melee classes and pretty weak in the casting classes. When we recruit, try to keep an eye out for possible members that would help strengthen our weak areas. To view the Class rundown go the the members page and click on the link "Class" near the top of the page.
11/10/01
I would like to have a raid in Kaesora on Wednesday November 21 at 9:15pm. But with the holidays approaching, I'm not sure how many of you will be available. I would say we need at least one full group. The level range is 30 to 45. Please sign up in the FORUM if you will be able to attend. If we do not get enough members to sign up by early Tuesday evening, I will announce that the raid will be postponed. Usually, we take our chances and hope that some will show up at the last minute, but this zone is probably a little more difficult to get to than most. And if we were going to hold it this Wednesday, I would advise you to start heading there early, so you are in place at raid time.
Kaesora maps and info
Photo by Tomani
Due to the holiday and many members being unavailable, this raid has been cancelled until further notice.
BUMMER!
The makers of the new expansion, Shadows of Luclin are recommending you have 512 Megabytes of RAM to fully enjoy the new graphics. To see the new character models at all, you will need 256 Megs of Ram. This seems outrageous to me. Granted, RAM is relatively cheap these days, but how many of you are planning to bump up to 256 MB let alone 512 MB?! It seems to me a lot of players are going to be running around "seeing" things differently than others. Some will see old models, some will see new. If you are wealthy enough to afford a horse, alot of players won't even see it when you ride into town!! Without the expansion they will just see you, not your horse! This reminds me of the missing Velious clothing models, only a thousand times worse! Please read the following info from Sony, then let me know your thoughts in the forum!
11/25/01
Minimum system requirements for
Shadows of Luclin expansion are outrageous!
By Kamdar Entil'Zha
The new minimum system requires are as follows:
Windows® 98/2000/ME/XP
Pentium® II 400Mhz or greater
256 MB RAM (512 MB RAM Recommended)
16 MB Direct3D compliant video card and hardware T&L (i.e. Nvidia GeForce/GeForce 2)
DirectX 8.0 compatible sound card
4X speed CD-ROM
450 MB+ hard drive space

Note: Although technically below the minimum specs, players with 128 MB of RAM will still be able to run Luclin by turning off the new character models.

The big change was in the RAM department, here's a blurb on it here:

The amount of memory required to display 40 all-new models with high quality textures, realistic bone structures, etc., greatly increased polygon counts and as such we have changed our minimum memory requirement to 256MB of RAM, and our recommended to 512MB of RAM.

Although technically below minimum specifications, EverQuest: The Shadows of Luclin WILL run with 128M of ram, and you will be able to see all the new zones, the new race (Vah Shir) and the new class (Beastlord) without much decrease in performance. However, if you want to see all the new models you will need at least 256MB of RAM. Even at 256MB you may need to modify new graphical options we will be providing. If you want smooth performance and fast loading times, we recommend that you get 512MB of RAM.
Arri has stepped down.
Though still in the guild, co-leader and founder Arri Ghent has stepped down from the High Council. Duties in the Real World are requiring her attention, like caring for her new baby daughter! She will not be able to be in Norrath nearly as much as she would like. Please join me in thanking Arri for all that she has given our Fellowship, and wish her well in raising the newest member of her family.
By Kamdar Entil'Zha

11/28/01
Mystykl has been promoted!
Please congratulate Mystykl Spirittears on her promotion to the High Council. Mysty has been with us from almost the beginning and has proven her worth to us time and again. She is always there when their are guildmates in need, and I'm sure she will continue to make us all very proud of her
By Kamdar Entil'Zha

If your level is somewhere between the low 30's and 40's, please join Ursi tonight, Wednesday, November 28th at 9pm eastern as she tears up the landscape in The Overthere!
